channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: How to watch Ireland vs New Zealand for *FREE* on Virgin Media Play
item.description: Ireland kickstart their Autumn Nations Series with a tough test against New Zealand — here's how you can watch the game from anywhere in the world for free.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Jones, TechRadar

item.title: A major telephoto camera upgrade is rumored for all the Samsung Galaxy S26 models
item.description: We have some more rumored details about what to expect from the Galaxy S26 phones arriving next year.
item.dc:creator: David Nield, TechRadar

item.title: A supercomputer chip going to space could change life on Earth
item.description: NVIDIA GPU space mission could revolutionize cloud services by enabling orbital data centers that make apps, games and AI tools faster and more efficient.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Hybristophilia: Study links TikTok to women’s sexual attraction to criminals
item.description: Ted Bundy had courtroom groupies. Jeffrey Dahmer and Richard Ramirez were sent love letters in prison. Now, in the age of social media, thousands like, share, and thirst in the comments over stylized fan edits of serial killers. There’s a term for this psychological phenomenon: hybristophilia.
item.dc:creator: Eve Upton-Clark, Fast Company

item.title: Amazon’s third-quarter results get a boost from its cloud computing business
item.description: Amazon posted higher fiscal third quarter profit and sales compared with a year ago, fueled by accelerating growth in its cloud computing business and strong spending by its customers looking for low prices at a time when inflation is resurging.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: Proton's new observatory reveals over 100 billion records breached - here's what you need to know
item.description: Proton, the company behind Proton VPN, has launched a new tool to track data breaches by monitoring the dark web. The Data Breach Observatory aims to provide a more accurate and timelier picture of cybercrime than official corporate disclosures.
item.dc:creator: Rene Millman, TechRadar

item.title: Bill Gates is just plain wrong about climate change
item.description: Bill Gates has invested billions over the last two decades to help fight climate change. But in a new blog post, he argues that world is too focused on cutting short-term emissions.
item.dc:creator: Adele Peters, Fast Company

item.title: Canadian government claims hacktivists are attacking water and energy facilities
item.description: Businesses operating ICS systems need “effective communication and collaboration," the Canadian government warns.
item.dc:creator: Sead Fadilpašić, TechRadar

item.title: Navigating Microsoft Project Online retirement: Risks, costs and strategic opportunities
item.description: Microsoft recently announced it will retire Project Online on September 30, 2026, prompting CIOs, CTOs and EPMO leaders to either rush a costly migration or modernize their processes. Those who see this as an opportunity for transformation will become more agile and better prepared for the future.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligenc
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Strengthening security with a converged security and networking platform
item.description: Today’s IT environment of multiple clouds, hybrid work, and the exploding popularity of AI has given cybercriminals unprecedented opportunities for launching attacks — and the traditional arsenal of tools organizations use to stop them isn’t working.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: 183 million email passwords leaked: Check yours now
item.description: Cybersecurity experts warn about one of the largest credential compilations ever found, urging users to check "Have I Been Pwned" and change passwords immediately.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) — Don't be fooled by the fog machine, spooky lights and fake bats: the robotics lab at Worcester Polytechnic Institute lab isn't hosting a Halloween party.
item.dc:creator: HOLLY RAMER, Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: GenAI can save employees 7.5 hours a week
item.description: Questions may linger about whether generative AI (genAI) is taking away jobs, but tools such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT, Google Gemini and Microsoft Copilot are apparently making employees more productive.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Unit testing Spring MVC applications with JUnit 5
item.description: Spring is a reliable and popular framework for building web and enterprise Java applications. In this article, you’ll learn how to unit test each layer of a Spring MVC application, using built-in testing tools from JUnit 5 and Spring to mock each component’s dependencies.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Google's corporate parent posts first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue in latest show of its power
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Google’s corporate parent on Wednesday announced its first-ever quarter with more than $100 billion in revenue, a milestone that illustrates the unwavering power of its internet empire amid legal and competitive threats. The news of Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Nvidia has started the $5 trillion club. A look at its rise, by the numbers
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion. The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: DHS attacks Washington Post over report on misleading footage of immigration operations
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) attacked The Washington Post over a report about footage of immigration operations the outlet characterized as misleading.
item.dc:creator: Tara Suter, The Hill

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Phony AI-generated videos of Hurricane Melissa flood social media sites
item.description: One viral video shows what appears to be four sharks swimming in a Jamaican hotel's pool as floodwaters allegedly brought on by Hurricane Melissa swamp the area. Another purportedly depicts Jamaica's Kingston airport completely ravaged by the storm.
item.dc:creator: TAIMOOR SOBHAN and KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Apple Watch Series 11: The things you don’t see
item.description: While there were solid improvements in the last generation of Apple’s popular wearable, the huge 24-hour battery life in Apple Watch Series 11 means this smartwatch has finally become what it always promised to be: a device capable of running all day and all night, which is especially for tasks like
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: The top 4 JVM languages and why developers love them
item.description: The Java virtual machine provides a high-performance, universal runtime for a wealth of popular languages beyond just Java. In this article, we’ll look at the characteristic strengths and common use cases of four of the most popular JVM languages: Kotlin, Scala, Groovy, and Clojure.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: A new framework aims to build a bridge across the defense acquisition valley of death
item.description: "We're hacking the complexity of the defense acquisition system so America's technologists can focus on solving technology problems," said Keoki Jackson. The post A new framework aims to build a bridge across the defense acquisition valley of death first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gerton, Federal News Network

item.title: IT shortcuts curb AI returns
item.description: Nearly all the companies I talk to today are using AI, but most fall short when it comes to getting real value from AI, aside from a select few. Cisco calls these AI standouts the “pacesetters.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: How to use passkeys to keep your computer safe
item.description: Learn how to use passkeys on Windows and Mac computers without cameras or fingerprint readers. Discover secure authentication methods that replace passwords.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: New military age demands new C2 comms
item.description: As purposely scattered forces replace massing, all units need access to rich and latency-free crucial situational data regardless of from where they operate. The post New military age demands new C2 comms first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Tom Temin, Federal News Network

item.title: OPM bringing protections for data breach victims to an end
item.description: The Office of Personnel Management transferred the current identity protection contract to GSA in September and will let it run out at the end of 2026. The post OPM bringing protections for data breach victims to an end first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Jason Miller, Federal News Network

item.title: Beware fake credit card account restriction scams
item.description: A phishing email scam targeting American Express customers shows how cybercriminals use fake urgent messages to steal personal and financial information.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Air Force opening up unused land on five military bases for private AI centers
item.description: Each project must be valued at more than $500 million and require at least 100 megawatts of power to qualify. The post Air Force opening up unused land on five military bases for private AI centers first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Michele Sandiford, Federal News Network
